trans-unit.source: Connect to SQL Database by using Ruby with TinyTDS on Ubuntu
trans-unit.target: Connect to SQL Database by using Ruby with TinyTDS on Ubuntu

trans-unit.source: Give a Ruby code sample you can run as a client on Ubuntu Linux to connect to Azure SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: Give a Ruby code sample you can run as a client on Ubuntu Linux to connect to Azure SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: Connect to SQL Database by using Ruby on Ubuntu Linux
trans-unit.target: Connect to SQL Database by using Ruby on Ubuntu Linux

trans-unit.source: This topic presents a Ruby code sample that runs on an Ubuntu Linux client computer to connect to an Azure SQL Database database.
trans-unit.target: This topic presents a Ruby code sample that runs on an Ubuntu Linux client computer to connect to an Azure SQL Database database.

trans-unit.source: Install the required modules
trans-unit.target: Install the required modules

trans-unit.source: Open your terminal and install FreeTDS if you do not have it on your machine.
trans-unit.target: Open your terminal and install FreeTDS if you do not have it on your machine.

trans-unit.source: After your machine is configured with FreeTDS, install Ruby if you do not already have it on your machine.
trans-unit.target: After your machine is configured with FreeTDS, install Ruby if you do not already have it on your machine.

trans-unit.source: If you have any issues with signatures, run the following command.
trans-unit.target: If you have any issues with signatures, run the following command.

trans-unit.source: If there are no issues with signatures, run the following commands.
trans-unit.target: If there are no issues with signatures, run the following commands.

trans-unit.source: Ensure that you are running version 2.1.2 or the Ruby VM.
trans-unit.target: Ensure that you are running version 2.1.2 or the Ruby VM.

trans-unit.source: Next, install TinyTDS.
trans-unit.target: Next, install TinyTDS.

trans-unit.source: Create a database, retrieve your connection string
trans-unit.target: Create a database, retrieve your connection string

trans-unit.source: The Ruby sample relies on the AdventureWorks sample database.
trans-unit.target: The Ruby sample relies on the AdventureWorks sample database.

trans-unit.source: If you do not already have AdventureWorks, you can see how to create it at the following topic: <link><linkText>Create your first Azure SQL Database</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: If you do not already have AdventureWorks, you can see how to create it at the following topic: <link><linkText>Create your first Azure SQL Database</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: The topic also explains how to retrieve the database connection string.
trans-unit.target: The topic also explains how to retrieve the database connection string.

trans-unit.source: Connect to your SQL Database
trans-unit.target: Connect to your SQL Database

trans-unit.source: The <link><linkText>TinyTDS::Client</linkText><title></title></link> function is used to connect to SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: The <link><linkText>TinyTDS::Client</linkText><title></title></link> function is used to connect to SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: Execute a SELECT statement and retrieve the result set
trans-unit.target: Execute a SELECT statement and retrieve the result set

trans-unit.source: The <link><linkText>TinyTds::Result</linkText><title></title></link> function is used to retrieve a result set from a query against SQL Database.
trans-unit.target: The <link><linkText>TinyTds::Result</linkText><title></title></link> function is used to retrieve a result set from a query against SQL Database.

trans-unit.source: This function accepts a query and returns a result set.
trans-unit.target: This function accepts a query and returns a result set.

trans-unit.source: The results set is iterated over by using <link><linkText>result.each do |row|</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: The results set is iterated over by using <link><linkText>result.each do |row|</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Inserting a row, passing parameters, and retrieving the generated primary key value
trans-unit.target: Inserting a row, passing parameters, and retrieving the generated primary key value

trans-unit.source: The code sample:
trans-unit.target: The code sample:

trans-unit.source: Passes parameters for values to be inserted in a row.
trans-unit.target: Passes parameters for values to be inserted in a row.

trans-unit.source: Inserts the row.
trans-unit.target: Inserts the row.

trans-unit.source: Retrieves the value that was generated for the primary key.
trans-unit.target: Retrieves the value that was generated for the primary key.

trans-unit.source: In SQL Database, the <link><linkText>IDENTITY</linkText><title></title></link> property and the <link><linkText>SEQUENCE</linkText><title></title></link> object can be used to auto-generate <link><linkText>primary key values</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: In SQL Database, the <link><linkText>IDENTITY</linkText><title></title></link> property and the <link><linkText>SEQUENCE</linkText><title></title></link> object can be used to auto-generate <link><linkText>primary key values</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To use TinyTDS with Azure, it is recommended that you execute several SET statements to change how the current session handles specific information.
trans-unit.target: To use TinyTDS with Azure, it is recommended that you execute several SET statements to change how the current session handles specific information.

trans-unit.source: Recommended SET statements are provided in the code sample.
trans-unit.target: Recommended SET statements are provided in the code sample.

trans-unit.source: For example, SET ANSI_NULL_DFLT_ON will allow new columns created to allow null values even if the nullability status of the column is not explicitly stated.
trans-unit.target: For example, SET ANSI_NULL_DFLT_ON will allow new columns created to allow null values even if the nullability status of the column is not explicitly stated.

trans-unit.source: To align with the Microsoft SQL Server <link><linkText>datetime</linkText><title></title></link> format, use the <link><linkText>strftime</linkText><title></title></link> function to cast to the corresponding datetime format.
trans-unit.target: To align with the Microsoft SQL Server <link><linkText>datetime</linkText><title></title></link> format, use the <link><linkText>strftime</linkText><title></title></link> function to cast to the corresponding datetime format.
